definition[0]: a narrow road in the countryside
definition[1]: a road in a city, often used in road names
example[1]: the Hilton Hotel in Park Lane
example[2]: a network of alleys and back lanes  (=narrow unimportant roads, often behind a row of houses)
definition[2]: one of the two or three parallel areas on a road which are divided by painted lines to keep traffic apart
example[3]: That idiot changed lanes without signalling.
example[4]: Use the outside lane for overtaking only.
example[5]: Cars in the fast lane were travelling at over 80 miles an hour.
definition[3]: one of the narrow parallel areas marked for each competitor in a running or swimming race
definition[4]: a line or course along which ships or aircraft regularly travel between ports or airports
